intro: Sageretia riparia, commonly known as the river sageretia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is typically found in moist, riparian habitats such as stream banks and river valleys. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with hairy undersides, and it produces small, fragrant yellow flowers in the spring. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. Sageretia riparia is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife.
